results.title: Mouth to mouth (AFC)
results.creator_credit: John Duigan, John Sainken, Victorian Film Corporation and Vega Film Productions
results.brief_description: Two teenage girls escape from a youth training centre and head for the city finding work in a food bar. Eventually they end up sharing a derelict warehouse with two unemployed boys they have met, one from an Italian family and the other from the country, and for awhile the openness and warmth of their relationships transcend their depressing economic circumstances. This is a film about survival, interpersonal relationships and the inevitable disintegration of the group. Cast includes Kim Krejus, Sonia Peat, Ian Gilmour, Sergio Frazetto. Cinematography by Tow Cowan; Nigel Buesst as camera assistant.

results.title: Moussorgsky: 'Pictures at an exhibition'
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion”.
Scenes of the flower gardens at Paris’ Louvre and Tuileries Park, children playing, fluffy chicks running about, the bustling market place at Limoges and the Paris Catacombs are shown to express part of Moussorgsky’s composition “Pictures at an Exhibition”. The composer wrote the music to pay homage to paintings by his friend Victor Hartmann.

results.title: Mousehunt
results.creator_credit: Gore Verbinski, Bruce Cohen, Tony Ludwig, Alan Richie and NBCUniversal
results.brief_description: When their elderly father dies, two brothers inherit the family business - the Smuntz string factory - along with a dilapidated house. Ernie Smuntz (Nathan Lane) was a once revered chef but is no more thanks to an unfortunate incident involving the mayor and a cockroach; brother Lars (Lee Evans) is a devoted string factory worker. On viewing the house they discover that it was designed by a revered architect at the turn of the century and is potentially worth millions. The only obstacle to the impending fortune is one wily long time resident, a mouse that’s proving impossible to catch. Christopher Walken has a brief role as a pest exterminator. The film is rated PG due to potentially horrible traps laid by each opponent, including a freakish cat. Cast also includes Vicki Lewis, Eric Christmas and Maury Chaykin.

results.title: Mouse around
results.brief_description: This very sweet film, with no dialogue, is the tale of a small mouse who is asleep in its nest in the basement of his house when a plumber calls to fix some leaky pipes. Tha mouse is awakened and moves to the edge of the nest to have a look, but it leans over too far and falls out into the plumbers coveralls. The charming story follows the little mouse’s adventures as he is transported around town from person until it eventually makes it safely back to the nest. Suitable for Kindergarten and Lower Primary students.

results.title: Mouse-activated candle lighter
results.creator_credit: Sterling Educational Films and Prism Productions
results.brief_description: The mouse-activated candle lighter illustrates various forms of potential and kinetic energy. It is made from a mousetrap, fishing rod, alarm clock, ice-pack, train motor, rubberband, match and candle. Students are challenged to find the many forms of energy hidden in the mechanism and their movements. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Mourning hours
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Mourning & memory (a fabric memorial)
results.brief_description:
Short documentary about the Korean War Honour Roll Quilt made by the Coleraine Sit and Sew Group to commemorate the 340 Australian soldiers killed in the Korean War. Includes stills and personal commentary from the Coleraine community and some of those who contributed to the 1000 hours of work it took to complete the quilt.
Made by Malcolm McKinnon and featuring Nola Gunning, Sherri Robertson, Maurie Butterworth, Lynn Gunning, Melba Plush and Janet Stanton.

results.title: Mountains, materials and technology
results.creator_credit: Mike Lockey, Bob Thorpe and London Television Service
results.brief_description: Examines some of the latest developments to help people survive in hostile environments. Discusses the manufacture of new fabrics which have been used to design a new generation of tents, clothing and sleeping bags for surviving high altitude conditions. Also looks at how the use of a global positioning system can be used to help the lives of people stranded at sea or on land.

results.title: Mountains of the moon
results.creator_credit: Bob Rafelson, Daniel Melnick and Indieprod
results.brief_description: In the 1850’s, two British officers, Captain Richard Burton and Lieutenant John Hanning Speke, set out on a spectacular adventure to discover the source of the Nile. As they pushed deeper and deeper into the hitherto unexplored regions of the African wilderness, they forged strong bonds of friendship in order to survive the great dangers which befell them. It was ironical then, that a friendship which had endured so much in Africa, was ultimately destroyed by the rigidity and competitiveness of Victorian England and its aristocracy. Burton, played by Patrick Bergin, is a larger than life character; a “maverick” geographer whose love affair and marriage to Isabelle, (Fiona Shaw), was “the stuff from which legends were made”. Speke, (Iain Glen), was the son of an aristocrat, bound by the strict conventions of his time. Together they embarked on one of the greatest explorations in history. Divided, their friendship in tatters, and their reputations in jeopardy, Speke ended his life tragically, and Burton quit England.

results.title: Mountains of memories : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Four stories from people with a deep connection to the Victorian Alpine Country. From different backgrounds, they share their experiences of working, living and travelling to the Alpine country, the stories of ancestors who have mined and lived in the region and how the Alpine country has left an indeliable impression on their lives.
